topic.title: Encryption at Rest
topic.shortdesc: Encryption at rest refers to encryption of data that resides on the physical media. It should be used to protect the data that is routinely stored by Couchbase Server.

section.title: Protecting Physical Media
section.p: Couchbase Server uses physical media to store files and indexes. If the media are stolen, the data becomes vulnerable to illicit access.

Therefore, to secure such data, encrypt all important data and index storage-locations, using transparent data encryption, provided by 3rd party on-disk encryption software-vendors; which denies data-access to anyone who either does not possess an appropriate encryption-key, or is otherwise determined to be outside the configured security policy. Such encryption ensures that stored data cannot be compromised; even if the database is stolen, copied, lost, or otherwise improperly accessed.

section.title: Encryption Targets
section.p: The tools listed above all allow either full disk or file-level encryptionto be used. If file-level is chosen, the following Couchbase directories and files should be encrypted:

ul.li:
Data and index file paths
Linux: /opt/couchbase/var/lib/couchbase/data
Windows: C:\Program Files\couchbase\server\var\lib\couchbase\data

Global Secondary Index file paths
Linux: /opt/couchbase/var/lib/couchbase/data/@2i
Windows: C:\Program Files\couchbase\server\var\lib\couchbase\data\@2i

Couchbase configuration files and directory
Linux: /opt/couchbase/var/lib/couchbase/data
Windows: C:\Program Files\couchbase\server\var\lib\couchbase\data

Couchbase password files
Linux: /opt/couchbase/var/lib/couchbase/isasl.pw and /opt/couchbase/var/lib/couchbase/config/.
Windows: C:\Program Files\couchbase\server\var\lib\couchbase\isasl.pw and C:\Program Files\couchbase\server\var\lib\couchbase\var\lib\config\.
